Terms of usage & exclusion of liability claims

Automatic connect with hotspots You don't like to manually connect your devices with hotspots? Pretty cool, ShareWiFi is able to automatically connect you with shared hotspots. For sure you can enable or disable this feature using our settings.
 
 Individual share of Wi-Fi credentials Visitors want to have access to your internet? No problem, you can share your network individually. Your credentials keep invisible. The devices of your friends will automatically be connected by ShareWiFi. Undo sharing is always possible.
 
 Once connected, always connected Connecting your devices (smartphone, tablet, notebook, ...) with a hotspot again and again is terrifying. Using ShareWiFi you only have to connect one single device. All your other devices are managed by ShareWiFi.
How can the sharing of networks be restricted?

ShareWiFi never shares a network automatically. You can always specify the devices or users for a share. ShareWiFi allows to share networks in three ways: • Device Share All your devices (where you are logged in) have access to the Wi-Fi credentials. • Group Share All the users you select have access to the shared Wi-Fi network. • Global Share Everybody have access to the shared Wi-Fi network. Remember that you are only allowed to share networks with confirmation of a network's owner. Else you infringes our terms of usage.
What happens when I share a network?

First, the Wi-Fi credentials are encrypted and transmitted to our server. Here they are stored encrypted.\n Next, they are decrypted and reencrypted for each device that has access (specified inside your share). Afterwards, the credentials are transmitted to these devices and stored inside the local ShareWiFi database. Also they are stored inside the Android network storage during the ShareWiFi app is running. This is necessary for the feature to undo the share.
